org.ietf.nea.pt.socket

Interface SocketHandler

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    SocketWrapper
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultSocketWrapper

    public interface SocketHandler
    Generic socket handler to hold a socket and mask its functions for the management of the contained socket.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes the socket.
      long getRxCounter()
      Returns the transport messages received thru the socket since initialization or last reset.
      long getTxCounter()
      Returns the messages transmitted thru the socket since initialization or last reset.
      void initialize()
      Initializes the socket by executing basic operations needed before any message exchange.
      boolean isOpen()
      Checks if the contained socket is open.
      void resetCounters()
      Resets the counters for the messages received and transmitted to zero.

    • Method Detail

      • isOpen

        boolean isOpen()
        Checks if the contained socket is open.
        Returns:
        true if socket is open and data can be written/read, false if socket is closed.

      • initialize

        void initialize()
                throws ConnectionException
        Initializes the socket by executing basic operations needed before any message exchange.
        Throws:
        ConnectionException - if socket is broken or closed

      • close

        void close()
        Closes the socket. No further data can be send. Socket cannot be reopened.

      • getRxCounter

        long getRxCounter()
        Returns the transport messages received thru the socket since initialization or last reset.
        Returns:
        the number of messages received

      • getTxCounter

        long getTxCounter()
        Returns the messages transmitted thru the socket since initialization or last reset.
        Returns:
        the number of messages transmitted

      • resetCounters

        void resetCounters()
        Resets the counters for the messages received and transmitted to zero.
